title: The doc of torch.nn.parallel.DistributedDataParallel maybe wrong
body_html:
📚 Documentation

See https://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.parallel.DistributedDataParallel

I think the developer forget to delete this content below when he rename DistributedDataParallelC10 to DistributedDataParallel:

 Currently this module is EXPERIMENTAL ONLY and should not be
used by normal users. Instead, please use DistributedDataParallel.

And the example mentions some non-existent functions like torch.distributed.FileStore and torch.distributed.ProcessGroupGloo:

 Example::
    >>> store = torch.distributed.FileStore("/tmp/tempfile.txt")
    >>> pg = torch.distributed.ProcessGroupGloo(store, rank, world_size)
    >>> net = torch.nn.DistributedDataParallel(model, pg)
body_text:

And the example mentions some non-existent functions like torch.distributed.FileStore and torch.distributed.ProcessGroupGloo:

 Example::
    >>> store = torch.distributed.FileStore("/tmp/tempfile.txt")
    >>> pg = torch.distributed.ProcessGroupGloo(store, rank, world_size)
    >>> net = torch.nn.DistributedDataParallel(model, pg)
body:
## 📚 Documentation

See https://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.parallel.DistributedDataParallel

I think the developer forget to delete this content below when he rename DistributedDataParallelC10 to DistributedDataParallel:

>      Currently this module is EXPERIMENTAL ONLY and should not be
>     used by normal users. Instead, please use DistributedDataParallel.

And the example mentions some non-existent functions like `torch.distributed.FileStore` and `torch.distributed.ProcessGroupGloo`:

>      Example::
>         >>> store = torch.distributed.FileStore("/tmp/tempfile.txt")
>         >>> pg = torch.distributed.ProcessGroupGloo(store, rank, world_size)
>         >>> net = torch.nn.DistributedDataParallel(model, pg)
